results.title: Alphabet
results.creator_credit: Robert Verrall, ONF | NFB and Eliot Noyes
results.brief_description: An amusing and energetic romp through the letters of the alphabet, wittily animated by Elliot Noyes Junior. Each letter has its own objects, animals or actions to suggest words it begins - A for Apple, Z for Zebra. None, however, retains the expected form for long, fading, changing at the artist’s whimsy. For anyone at the reading-readiness stage, young or old, this is a language film to sharpen words and humour.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Verrall, ONF | NFB and Eliot Noyes

results.title: Alpha Omega = Alfa Omega
results.brief_description: A satirical cartoon describing the life of a typical modern man from childhood to old age, in six epochs. Between each epoch the individual has to wind himself up enough to see himself through the next phase of his life, but eventually the human “spring” can take no more. No commentary is used, simple music sets the scene.

results.title: Alouette, Canada's first satellite
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Crawley Films and C R Yool
results.brief_description: Design, construction, function, and launching of Canada’s first earth satellite. On the other side of the ionosphere, Alouette tracks the solar disturbances that affect radio communication and transmits much useful information for research purposes. Uses animated diagrams.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Crawley Films and C R Yool

results.title: Alouette
results.brief_description: Norman McLaren is noted for his many innovative and experimental film animation techniques. He co-animated, with Rene Jodoin, this item for including in a sing-along series, “Lets All Sing Together” (No.1). Single-frame animation of paper cutouts was the technique used.

results.title: Aloud / Bagatelle
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, David Verrall, Douglas MacDonald and Donald McWilliams
results.brief_description: Canadian poet Earle Birney indulges his love of trains in this performance of his sound poem “To Swindon from London by Britrail”. Told in fluent “trainish”, he interprets the experience of excursions by rail. Imagination sparked by the rhythm of wheels and the clink of couplings, Birney hums, hisses and hoots his way through archival footage of vintage trains and English countryside. A must for language, animation and train buffs.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, David Verrall, Douglas MacDonald and Donald McWilliams

results.title: Along these lines
results.brief_description: A history of the way in which language enlarged the communication capacity of the human animal and how the telephone expanded and transformed the functions of language. Made for the Bell Telephone Company in Canada.

results.title: Along the way
results.brief_description: An experimental animated film exploring the realistic image of a human figure running through abstract and surrealistic manipulations. Film without dialogue.

results.title: Along the track in Central Australia
results.brief_description: Filmed in 1952 by Phillip Crosbie Morrison and the commentary edited from his recorded talks describing a tour with the Royal Australian Ornithologists’ Union, visiting Hermannsburg, Palm Valley, Ayers Rock and Mount Olga. Gives a broad view of the environment as a whole, emphasising the natural beauty and variety of the region and its wild life and showing that although arid it is not all desert.

results.title: Along the Sepik
results.creator_credit: Frank Bagnall, Stanley Hawes, R. Maslyn Williams, Ian Dunlop and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australia today”.
Shows the duties and responsibilities of an Australian Patrol Officer in the Upper Sepik River area of New Guinea. With law and order they try to introduce education, health services, agricultural services and a wider political concept. The rugged mountains and diverse native tribes present innumerable problems - most important is to encourage them to live together peacefully.

results.title: Along the road (Thailand)
results.creator_credit: Soerabaia Pictures and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Shows a road built by Australians in Thailand and the ways in which it is used for communication, trading and travel, by farmers, traders, foresters and families. Suitable for middle-upper Primary School. No other credits available.
